intro: Elphegea quinquenervia, commonly known as the five-veined elphegea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with five distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Elphegea quinquenervia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
